On 8/23/06, Pat Farrell <pfarrell@...> wrote:

>JUnit is a tool. I like what it does. I'd like to learn better ways to
>use it to make my life as a developer better. It is hard to find any
>useful information between all the rants.

What do you want to know? Just go ahead and ask. Most of us around
here will lay down the boxing gloves to answer genuine questions.

> Purity tests and arguments about them are noise.

Are they in this instance? I agree that in most philosophical
discussions they would be close to noise because of their subjective
nature. In testing, we deal with more measurable stuff. An
application, or body of code, works and the degree to which it works
according to it's specification can be measured.

Simon
